Show / Hide Table of Contents

Class SqlServerProvider

Database provider implementation for Microsoft SQL Server. Responsible for dialect translation, bulk operations and temporal table support.

Inheritance
object

BulkOperationProvider

ApplyPaging(OptimizedSqlBuilder, int?, int?, string?, string?)

Adds SQL Server paging clauses to the SQL builder using OFFSET and FETCH.

Declaration
public override void ApplyPaging(OptimizedSqlBuilder sb, int? limit, int? offset, string? limitParameterName, string? offsetParameterName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
OptimizedSqlBuilder sb

The SQL builder to append to.
int? limit

Maximum number of rows to return.
int? offset

Number of rows to skip before starting to return rows.
string limitParameterName

Parameter name for the limit value.
string offsetParameterName

Parameter name for the offset value.

CreateSavepointAsync(DbTransaction, string, CancellationToken)

Creates a database savepoint within the given transaction. The default implementation throws as savepoints are provider specific and may not be supported.

Declaration
public override Task CreateSavepointAsync(DbTransaction transaction, string name, CancellationToken ct = default)
Parameters
Type Name Description
DbTransaction transaction

The transaction in which to create the savepoint.
string name

Name of the savepoint.
CancellationToken ct

Token used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
Returns

IsAvailableAsync()

Determines whether the provider can operate in the current environment. The base implementation simply returns true but derived providers may perform runtime checks for required assemblies or database availability.

Declaration
public override Task<bool> IsAvailableAsync()
Returns
Type Description
Task<bool>
Overrides
DatabaseProvider.IsAvailableAsync()
